column4: i am upgrading from dapper->edgy. i only have packages from the official ubuntu archives. i did it via apt-get dist-upgrade. it is saying how "courier-authdaemon" is in a bad inconsistent state. i have tried -f upgrade, reconfiguring, reinstalling, etc

i foobared my system when upgrading from dapper->edgy. I changed the sources and did an apt-get dist-upgrade... after i foobared it i saw the upgrade help site (on help.ubuntu.com)... is it too late to fix it?
all my packages come from the repo
lemme get you a copy of the errors
that's a known bug i believe, let me dig it
not fixed yet, but i don't know if it can be fixed manually, reading the reports
well, there are some people who claimed they could fix it manually
look at the suggestion in the last comment, and perhaps also the suggestion in the comment that starts "ok, here is how i fixed it"
thanks for the courier-authdaemon bug pages... i am looking now, (sorry my boss called me in)
